campaign.story:
Accession was formed from the question, "Can it ever be a good idea to 'brick' your own computer?"
YES, YES IT CAN.
The focus of this project is to build a prototype of Accession.

Why Not Use Hardware AND Software to Protect Your Data?
Accession is a different way of looking at security for your computer. It is a combined hardware and software solution designed to make your computer completely inaccessible when you are not using it, employs a philosophy of compartmentalization in design, integrates a multitude of security software to help protect it AND utilizes a USB "key" to run it.

Hardware Designed for Security
The building blocks of Accession start with the hardware. Accession will be built utilizing three separate encrypted solid state drives; one to store specialized operating system files (not actual operating systems) and two additional drives to store daily backups and hourly snapshots.
Visual Representation of the USB "Key"
At the core of Accession is a USB flash drive that it uses as a "key". This flash drive houses RiseOS, our own operating system that runs the entire computer. When this "key" is removed, it "bricks" the computer, making your data completely inaccessible as there is no operating system to hack.
Imagine being able to physically secure your computer in something as simple as a lock box when your work day is over. Accession allows you to do this and more. These "keys" can even be assigned to workers or employees if multiple people use the same computer.
Actual Screenshot of Accession
Integrated Software Solutions
Accession doesn't only rely on its unique structure for security, it will contain software solutions to help protect your data. This includes encryption on all hard drives, automated primary and secondary remediation systems to recover your entire computer in the event of a catastrophic viral infection (including ransomwares!) or other disastrous failure, real-time monitoring and a data loss prevention (DLP) system.

Compartmentalization
Compartmentalization- the division of something into sections or categories. Also a military term for separating the details of an operation between operatives to prevent the entire operation from being compromised if any one operative is captured.
This is the philosophy behind Accession.
Actual Screenshot of Accession
Accession not only compartmentalizes your data through hardware means, but also through software. Accession will have the ability to run multiple, separate operating systems within RiseOS. These can either be a transplanted, existing installation or a fresh installation.
Actual Screenshot of Accession
This means your current computer, programs AND data can be transferred to Accession with NO loss of functionality!
This compartmentalization combined with all your data separated between three encrypted physical locations, which are only accessible through the USB "key", decreases the chances of any of your data becoming compromised.

The Project As It Sits Now
As of the writing of this project, we currently have two "working models" of Accession (NEITHER is an actual prototype, as these "working models" are not built using the planned form factor, CPU, RAM or hard drive specifications of the actual proposed prototype system, however, RiseOS is installed on,and working from,a USB flash drive on both "working models"). These "working models" were built so we could begin the coding and building of the operating system and additional security features, and to start preliminary testing. The images above contain actual screenshots of RiseOS. We added the monitor to make it look fancy. We have secured a vendor, and contacted numerous others, to manufacture the prototype computer (without the operating system) and the finished systems.
RiseOS is roughly 60% complete as of this writing. It is based on another operating system, SanctumOS, we created, so the basics are already in place, what is remaining to complete is additional in-depth coding to enhance the security software and remediation systems and to tighten up the look and feel of the operating system to make it more familiar and user-friendly.We are also developing a simpler graphical interface for unlocking the encrypted drives.
The "working models" of Accession have gone through preliminary testing of the primary and secondary remediation systems against ransomware infections; specifically Petya, NotPetya, WannaCry and Ryuk. We believed this was essential to complete as soon as possible as this is a primary feature of Accession. These remediation plans have been used successfully on other solutions offered by Archai Solutions, LLC, but not with this complex of a design. They have performed admirably in all preliminary tests and recovered 100% from each infection. The recovery process took between 45 and 53 minutes depending on the infection and whether it was the primary or secondary remediation system. We project that the actual prototype recovery time will be quicker due to the higher proposed hardware specifications. We will be uploading a screen capture of a ransomware infection on Accession and the recovery process through the primary remediation system once the security coding is more complete, roughly within the second week of April. (this video will be edited ONLY for time constraints. We don't believe ANYONE wants to sit through a 53-minute video of a bar slowly moving across the screen, although we will make the complete, unedited video available to any backer who wishes to see it. [UPDATE: The video actually ended up being 87 minutes, see our UPDATES]). The secondary remediation system does take the computer out of the operating system, so doing a screen capture of this remediation system will be a little difficult. This secondary remediation system is planned only to be used as a last ditch recovery system.

Plans for Funding
The funds we are raising will be used for the following:
-  The materials for, and construction of, an actual prototype system, this includes all the proposed hardware (i.e. form factor shell, CPU, motherboard, RAM, hard drives and USB drive);
-  The hiring of one or two additional employees for additional coding, both controlled-environment and "real world" testing, and other responsibilities;
-  The filing of a provisional patent and of the actual patent once Accession is completed;
-  Expenses associated with testing Accession in a "real world" business environment. This includes the cost of commonly used business software such as Quickbooks, MySQL, CRM software, etc. to ensure Accession does not inhibit any such software;
-  Expenses associated with testing Accession within different business network structures. This includes, but is not limited to, virtual servers, VPNs, networked drives, NAS systems, cloud storage, cloud computing, etc.;
-  The writing, editing and printing of a "quick start" user's manual and the creation of a troubleshooting website;
-  An additional "slush" fund for unexpected expenses. We have tried to take into account any and all expenses associated with this project, but as any creator or developer will tell you, there is always something unexpected that appears.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks:
 We are not new to technology. Our team of two have a combined 57 years working with, building and designing computers, hardware and software. We are fully versed in multiple forms of coding for Windows and Linux. Josh started his own computer repair and service company, Trust Tech Management (www.trusttechmanagement.com), in 2015 geared towards providing honest, inexpensive and quality computer services for small businesses and residential users. Realizing there was a need for innovative cybersecurity solutions for small businesses, he started Archai Solutions, LLC (www.archaisolutions.com) unofficially in 2020 and officially in 2021, with the philosophy that standard cybersecurity techniques were not working and new, revolutionary solutions were needed. If the accepted solutions were enough, hackers and ransomware attacks would not be the threat they are.

 We have been working hard to ready Accession for Kickstarter, but life is nothing if not unpredictable. Here are the risks we foresee and our plans for assessing them:

CURRENT SILICON SHORTAGE: With everything that has happened in the world in the past year, every day life has become disrupted. Manufacturing and supply has been no different. Anyone in technology knows that there is currently a shortage of silicon. This is making computer parts, such as motherboards, graphics cards, etc. in short supply. We have identified and contacted numerous vendors to help reduce any shortages or lead times we may come across that could prevent fulfillment of Accession.

CODING AND DESIGN: Even with all our experience, there's no way around it; coding and design takes time. This along with our philosophy to make this system as simple to operate as possible and give it an easy-to-understand, familiar look and feel, sometimes makes this process a little slow. We are designing this system for EVERYONE, not just technology fanatics.

ACTS OF GOD: Every day can bring new challenges. Fires, natural disasters, emergency situations can all happen in the blink of an eye. We are using two different locations for R&D to prevent any natural disaster from disrupting the development of Accession.

updates.update_userinfo: As Promised! The video of Accession in Action!
updates.update_content:
First off, a big thank you to all of our backers! We are on our way to making this a reality!
Secondly, as promised, here is the video of Accession in action. This shows how the primary remediation system built into Accession will recover from any ransomware or serious viral infection. Yes, that is the actual Petya ransomware being used. Yes, this is an actual screen capture of the infection and recovery process. This video has been edited, but only for time. This whole process took 87 minutes. I'm sure no one wants to sit through 87 minutes of watching this. The full, unedited video is available for any potential or current backer to see if they so wish. Just contact me and I will send a link.
A quick warning though, this video does contain flashing screens. If there is anyone that is sensitive to this, please don't watch.

campaign.story:
This project's primary goal is to enable you to process images using the Python programming language. You will be "leveled up" by gaining this knowledge.

Regardless if you are a beginner with Python or a seasoned programming rock-star, Michael Driscoll will help you continue to grow in your developer journey. There are hundreds of awesome tutorials on his blog, Mouse Vs Python, that you can read for free! 

Image Processing with Python uses the Pillow package. Pillow is a fork of the Python Imaging Library. Pillow originally released in 2010 and has been stable for many years. It is a well known and trusted imaging library for Python. 

You can rest assured that Michael knows Python. He has been programming and writing about it for over a decade. Michael also has EIGHT other Python books.

You can get a free sample of the book using this link. This contains a PDF version of the first 3 chapters.

Pillow: Image Processing with Python will be published in April 2021

If you miss the campaign, the book can also be purchased on Leanpub: https://leanpub.com/pillow/

This book will be printed in COLOR. Here is an example photo from an early version of the book:
Full-color Paperback
Stretch Goals
Stretch goal #1: $5000
Add a chapter on ImageOps https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/3.0.x/reference/ImageOps.html 
Add a chapter on alternatives to Pillow
Stretch Goal #2: 1000 backers or $10,000
Create a video tutorial version of the book. I have a much better setup for this than I did the first time I tried to do video tutorials. Note: The video tutorial may be released later on after the book release. 
What You'll Learn
You can use Python and Pillow to do basic, intermediate, and advanced image manipulation. In this book, you will discover how to do the following:

Convert Your Images to Black and White
Color to Black and White
Get Image Metadata with Pillow
You will create a GUI that can display EXIF data extracted from JPEGs using Pillow
EXIF Viewer
Apply ImageFilters
Pillow comes with an ImageFilter module that lets you add sharpening, detail, smoothing, embossing, and other effects to your photos, like this one:
Buffalo with an Edge Filter Applied (right)
You will learn how to create a GUI to apply these filters using PySimpleGUI or wxPython:
Pillow GUI for Applying Filters
Cropping, Rotating and Resizing
Pillow gives you the ability to crop, rotate and resize your images too!
Rotating / Mirroring GUI
Pillow: Image Processing with Python will teach you all these things and much, much more!

Table of Contents
Want to know what else is in this book? Then look no further! Here is the high-level table of contents:

Chapter 1 - Pillow Basics
Chapter 2 - Colors
Chapter 3 - Getting Image Metadata (ExifTags / TiffTags)
Chapter 4 - Image Filters
Chapter 5 - Cropping, Rotating & Resizing Images
Chapter 6 - Enhancing Images (ImageEnhance)
Chapter 7 - Combining Images
Chapter 8 - Drawing with Pillow (ImageDraw)
Chapter 9 - ImageChops
Chapter 10 - Pillow Integration with GUIs
Note: This table of contents is subject to change. Chapters may be re-ordered, renamed, added, or deleted as the author sees fit.

Writing Style
This book will be written using my original conversational style. What this means is that the chapters will probably vary in size more than most programming books.
I still follow the rule of giving simple examples paired with simple explanations instead of spending an inordinate amount of time re-explaining the same subject over and over.

If you've never read anything of mine before, you can download the original Python 101 for free or read it online. You can also check out my blog for writing examples.

What's the money for?
The money will cover the initial print run of the book for the backers. It will also cover any ISBN costs. Finally will cover copyright registration and the cost of my illustrator.

I'm looking forward to working with my backers to make the best Python book possible!

About the Author
I'm a professional full-time Python programmer by day and Python blogger by night. I've been programming almost exclusively in Python for almost 15 years. I am also a contributor to Real Python. I also ran a successful campaign for my other books:

Python 101 (1st Edition)
Python 201: Intermediate Python
ReportLab: PDF Processing with Python
Jupyter Notebook 101
Creating GUI Applications with wxPython
I have two books that are also published by publishers other than myself:
 wxPython Recipes (Apress)
 Python Interviews (Packt)

Book formats
The finished book will be made available in the following formats:
paperback (at the appropriate reward level)
PDF
mobi (Kindle format)
epub
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Frankly, I don't see much of a risk. The book shouldn't have any major delays and I hope to finish it early if possible.

However the unexpected does happen which is why I have given myself a buffer until November to finish the book. I am confident that I can meet that goal or exceed it.

I always try to pick Python packages that are known to have firm APIs that don't change often. This prevents the books from becoming obsolete quickly.
Reusability and recyclability
Most of my backers choose to purchase the eBook, which keeps more trees from being turned into paper products.

campaign.story:
This‌ ‌catchy,‌ ‌witty‌ ‌compilation‌ ‌of‌ ‌inventions,‌ ‌filled‌ ‌with‌ ‌beautiful‌ ‌illustrations,‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌wonderful‌ ‌gift‌ ‌for‌ ‌collectors,‌ ‌enthusiasts,‌ ‌and‌ ‌curious‌ ‌minds.‌
Story
Have you ever imagined visiting the past with full knowledge of modern information and technology? If you told people from the Middle Ages or Ancient Egypt about a telephone, a car, or electricity, they would take you for a deity or a superhero. But do you actually know how these things work?
As a child, before bed, I used to imagine with my dad what things like bowstrings would be made of in ancient times. In the morning, looking it up, we would be startled to discover that bowstrings were made of veins and if you wanted instead to make one from gunpowder ingredients you had to urinate on hay!

As I got older, I got into mechanics and discovered that many apparently simple things are based on brilliant ideas. All the discoveries and inventions that seemed incredible and almost magical when I was a child actually were just as fantastical as I imagined!

I realized that most people knew very little about how such inventions of our civilization as a plow, a mill, a blast furnace or glass are made and how they work. I began making a list of the most amazing inventions I would like to tell my children about. Later I added illustrations, which became more and more bizarre and mysterious. After some time, I finished a draft of The Book of Incredible Inventions and Discoveries. 

Now I want to share this book with everyone who hasn’t lost their juvenile curiosity and love for mystery. If you are as fascinated by technical, military, medical and artistic inventions as I am, you definitely will love The Book of Incredible Inventions and Discoveries and The Ultimate Guide to Rebuilding a Civilization. This book is an illustrated encyclopedia of mechanisms, processes and materials that have played a significant role in human history.
There is no other book like this. Currently, information about inventions is scattered here and there in boring textbooks and manuals that are neither understandable nor inspiring. The Book of Incredible Inventions and Discoveries presents the most meaningful facts about our culture combined with out-of-this-world ideas and fabulous illustrations. It is the first treatise of its kind on these spectacular magical inventions. Only with your help will we  be able to create this exceptional book.
Vsevolod  Co-founder of The Book

The Book is a unique artifact similar to the most mysterious and mantic books of humankind. The visual symbolism of the book connects it to the prominent fifteen-century Voynich manuscript while its uncommon and original ideas are similar to the Summa Technologiae of Stanisław Lem. The book is also influenced by the aesthetics of the renowned Codex Seraphinianus. The Ultimate Guide is a real masterpiece and an endless source of inspiration.

On the pages of The Ultimate Guide you will find visual instructions for making handy mechanisms and materials in case you lose them or forget. With over 400 pages of detailed and catchy illustrations, you will forget about everything and bury yourself in the book. You won’t stop thinking of what you saw.
This section is all about how to be healthy, cheerful, and fresh. Here you’ll find out how to give mouth-to-mouth resuscitation without getting punched in the nose. You’ll learn how to remove your appendix if you don’t need it anymore. We’ll tell you which mushrooms are tasty and which mushrooms are fun (what are mushrooms and what are shrooms). We’ll teach you yoga and Chinese needle therapy. Believe us, all of this knowledge will come in handy in the ruins of the post-apocalyptic world! (not to mention in the modern world, given the cost of medical insurance). We’ll also explain how to make gypsum, glue, penicillin or even all three together from scratch.
The whole world is a big chemistry lab and the only limit here is your lack of knowledge. If there’s sand under your feet, you can make glass. If you see trees around you, it’s a step from there to making paper. The magic of our civilization, which is electricity, can also be made from easily accessible materials. There are tons of ways to make it and we’ll reveal the most original one.
Researchers have concluded that human brain development was always influenced by laziness and greed. We want to have as much as possible with minimal effort and that’s what makes us geniuses. Mills and water pumps will do the work for you. The combustion engine will help you in traveling any distance. Cameras made of boxes and paper with photosensitive surfaces will immortalize your successes
In all the worlds of the Multiverse in which this book will be published, we’ve agreed that killing people isn’t cool. We wish these inventions never appeared, but still….The trebuchet is pretty darn good. To create saltpeter, which is the main gunpowder component, all it takes is hay and human urine. How long will you have to pee in the pit full of hay? You’ll find this out in The Ultimate Guide. By the way, did you know that the alchemist who discovered gunpowder thought he was creating the elixir of life? Well, if you throw pots full of gunpowder at your enemies, you’ll become immortal (for a while).
The home of ancient man began from fire, so if you don’t want to be dumber than your ancestors you need to learn how to use flint and steel. If all goes smoothly, you’ll be able to build a log house, weave a rug, mould houseware out of clay and build a boat. You’ll learn the art of tying knots and using natural dyes. But above all, you’ll learn how to construct a unique top-class mousetrap, so rodents won’t have any chance. (Failing to do that, read about cat domestication in the Farming section.)

It’s said that wheat domesticated humans rather than the opposite. Agriculture made us who we are today, so in this book you’ll find a detailed description of grain types and animal farming principles. You’ll learn to make fishing nets, help to deliver calves, procure salt and honey. But first you should learn to brew the best-ever wheat beer. (Which will literally be the best beer in the world since you’ll be the only brewer after the fall of civilization)
Life is not only about surviving; it’s also about not dying of boredom. There will be fewer fights in your survivor camp if you give people cards and chess. Your children won’t set fire to your house (built thanks to the instructions of the Hearth and Home section) because they will be playing ball or flying a kite. You’ll become a local movie mogul if you make a phenakistiscope, a device that creates the illusion of motion. By the way! We’ll tell you how to make a vibrator.


There is nothing similar to the sound of the Australian didg. It’s literally the voice of spirits. This musical instrument exists in all the worlds of the Multiverse, so make sure to read a manual on how to make it. The same applies to the jaw harp, which can be found in the history of any nation on the earth and beyond. During your interworld journey a sitar and a bell will come in handy too. Tell whomever you meet about the music theory of our world and don’t forget to ask about their notation too. 

Rituals, traditions, and etiquette are as significant as mechanisms and materials. The most basic and peculiar inventions of human communication were collected in The Ultimate Guide. How do you tie a tie to make a good impression? What is the philosophy behind fashion? What are the rules of setting a table and marking the road? How exactly do you carry out seppuku in the way that will most impress others?
A Dutch philosopher Johan Huizinga in his book Homo Ludens proved that games appeared long before culture. People enjoyed games and invented a gillion of different games in the ensuing thousand years. Many games also keep arcane knowledge. For example, card suits depict archetypes of the human psyche, chessmen talk about the social organization and hierarchy. You’ll be able to rule the whole world if you know how the main games of humanity, such as football or Monopoly, work and what rules they have.

People had not yet invented writing when they discovered that fried meat was much better than raw and that fermented fruit juice dissipated sorrow and made them sleep like a baby. Over time, cooking has become a real art that requires imagination and ingenuity. Asians held raw fish in a pressing machine for weeks to make sushi. Arab nomads occasionally discovered cheese recipe by keeping milk in bags made of sheep’s stomachs. And don’t forget to learn the recipe of the main food invention, which is bread. Without bread you won’t be able to make your new world fully civilized. 
The intriguing illustrations that combine engineering drawings and medieval art depict the structure of devices and materials in many forms throughout the many worlds of the Multiverse. What does it mean? According to The Ultimate Guide, people find new ideas in the world’s information realm rather than come up with new ones. This means that development of these ideas isn’t connected to anything really. They can appear out of the blue in different worlds of the Multiverse.
In one of these worlds, medieval peasants work fields with tills attached to bicycles. In another world, gladiators of the Colosseum fight under stadium lights. There is a world where indium-gallium alloys are the essence of microelectronics instead of silicon. In one more world zeppelin became the main means of transport when humanity discovered a cheap way to produce helium as opposed to explosive hydrogen. On the pages of The Book of Incredible Inventions and Discoveries you’ll find tons of such examples and probably will think that similar ideas have come to your mind before.
It is made for satisfying curiosity, widening the horizons of your mind, drawing inspiration and teleporting from world to world.
This book will make an excellent gift for all those who are keen on art, technology, history and such puzzling sciences as semiotics and hermeneutics.
It is made for satisfying curiosity, widening the horizones of your mind, drawing inspiration and teleporting from world to world. The book will make an excellent gift for all those who are keen on art, technology, history and even such puzzling sciencesas semiotics and hermeneutics. 
Click here to see detailed instruction on how to use add-ons if you are existing backer. 





The size of The Ultimate Guide is around 13x9 inches and 4.5 pounds. All the pages of the book will be printed on special thick 157gsm paper. This is a high-quality mat art paper, which definitely feels well and holds well. The Ultimate Guide will be a hardcover book and will have stunning matt laminated cover.
The Ultimate Guide contains knowledge of humankind and it can’t come to life without the help of people. We need the support of enthusiasts who believe in the unique future of the human mind.
                                                   In the first place, the raised money will go to the illustrators because The Book of Incredible Inventions and Discoveries forms a collection of great detailed pictures. The budget also includes the work of content editors and the book’s printing.
PLAY

The Book project is promoted by REPROJECT.


FB agencies:
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
"More than $50,000,000 has been raised with Sprint's support"
This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $300MM through crowdfunding.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
We’d like to specify what has been already done since the end of our campaign on Kickstarter in January. The first and most important thing was to assemble the team of professionals. We spent some time looking for illustrators whose drawing style would be convenient and could match with others’ styles. It was a big deal to find writers for this project as soon as our expectations were rather high and we had a huge number of unsuccessful attempts before we could find writers who can perfectly complement their texts with the illustrations. We also searched out for many researches who support both our writers and illustrators with all the needed technical information. We managed to find experts in scientific, medical, technical and social fields who constantly advise us on what information the book should include to provide readers precise and workable instructions. All in all, we have 36 people in our team, about 10 side experts and this number is constantly growing. After that came the second step of our work which unfortunately took more time and turned out to be more complicated than we expected. We all had to get used to each other to stabilize and optimize the working process. The problem on the technical side was that we’re an international team of nearly 40 people living in different countries all over the world. Time lag challenged our determination and commitment to work together on this amazing project. Finally, we won this fight but there were many others yet to come. Sometimes it was a hard time for us to learn to hear each other, we could meet every day and argue about many small and insignificant thing for hours. We still meet every day but now we can proudly say that our meetings are more productive than ever before. At last, making process is synchronized and we’re actively working on the book. We’ve made a good progress which you can see on this infographic:

Dear backers, 
It’s time for a new update! First of all, we wanted to thank you for your patience as it’s been a while since our last update.

We want to share the process with you. The Ultimate Guide is a story told by a multinarrator about a multiverse and it seems a great and interesting challenge for us to fulfill this idea.  To bring this concept to life we’re working hardly and experimenting on both levels of the book – illustrations and texts.

We think that the best way to describe our way of working process is to say that we use cut-and-try approach. We try a lot of ideas and we cancel a lot of them to obtain the best result. For example, you can see how each sketch of the Ultimate Guide is being changed and modified multiple times until it becomes a cartoon and then a complete illustration.

Dear backers,

It's time for one more survey since we've promised you a possibility to choose whether you want to place your name or name of your relative/friend in the Ultimate Guide.

We decided on Google Forms as the fastest and the easiest way to collect this information.
Link to the survey: https://forms.gle/sUQEWLnuGuDiAmjy7

Hello everyone!
We are excited to share that we are ready to start sending surveys using Kickbooster. The survey will allow you to confirm your pledge level, confirm your Kickstarter add-ons (which will be visible in your Survey Summary), and provide you with the opportunity to purchase additional add-ons. Please keep an eye out on your inbox for an email from Kickbooster throughout the week while we roll them out.

Hi there!
Not here to disturb you, just wanted you to know that we’re in a deep book production process right now. The book making turned out to be difficult but cool! All in all, our team has 22 people from all over the world and we're proud that we managed to set up this project. We meet online, guide the working process, coordinate the team and get faster in progress.

A month has passed since our Kickstarter campaign ended and we would like to share with you what we have managed to do since then. We have put together a stellar team that will work on the book over the next 8 months and are happy to introduce you….Behold!:

campaign.story:
Are you planning to start a career in blockchain?
Or looking to explore more into cryptocurrency?
Or just wanted to brush up with the latest skills of blockchain or cryptocurrency?
If yes, then here’s an exclusive E-Degree that is designed to help anyone master the Blockchain & Cryptocurrency to the core.


Blockchain & Cryptocurrency is established at an incredibly fast rate & have taken the business world by storm.

The blockchain industry is projected to reach $60.7 Billion by 2024.
By the end of 2020, cryptocurrency will help the banking industry to gain over $1 Billion. 
Dubai is all set to have the world's first blockchain-powered government by the end of 2020.
 75% of IoT companies will adapt to the blockchain by the end of 2020.
The USA Expenditure on Blockchain solutions including cryptocurrency is expected to reach $4.3 Billion by 2022.

These are cutting-edge technologies.
There is a high demand with ample opportunities in the market.
Blockchain infrastructure reduces the risk of data security.
Can integrate with new techs like IoT, AI ML & so on.
High job prospects with a salary of up to $175,000 per year.
There are now 14 job openings for every 1 blockchain developer.
Blockchain’s exponential global growth resulted in staff shortages and skills-shortfall challenges.
A job placement marketplace (Toptal), reported a growth of 700% for blockchain engineering roles.
  As per one agency, 40% of the fully managed software development projects requested blockchain skills.

campaign.story:
Review & Hands-On By Tyriel Wood - VR Tech!! 
"Right away the clarity of the 5K display over here is pretty impressive!! It is impossible to spot any pixel on the screen that is projected." --Tyriel Wood
Made by Unbox Fantasy, a professional crew assemblage from the former editors of tech review media. 
Still tethered to the past with an old bulky head-mounted display (HDM) or backpack-sized HD monitor weighing on your mood while working or watching entertainment? You may be feeling dizzy due to the visual ‘melee attack’ of first-gen displays or bothered by curious prying eyes when watching videos in public, or feeling self-conscious like a time-traveler with a bizarre gadget strapped to your head while trying to relax with some multimedia?
Get GodView and set yourself free from old technology for an incredibly immersive visual experience for fun and productivity. Whether you are a hardcore gamer, movie fanatic, or busy commuter looking for an entertainment solution, GodView is a revolutionary solution that delivers an extradimensional experience for multimedia. A next-gen wearable with a perfectly balanced super lightweight, affordable, and stylish design suitable for everyday use.
NB. I am an animated GIF - give me a second to load :-)

GodView is designed as a standard-setting smart device, to bring user & budget-friendly mixed reality to life. Any content on your mobile phone can be cast wirelessly to the 300-inch virtual display in front of you.  It unveils vivid imagery before your eyes, empowering you with superb vision even more lifelike than what your eyes can show you.  
NB. I am an animated GIF - give me a second to load :-)
High Resolution
GodView serves as a match for a professional monitor with a resolution of 2*2560*2560 (5K) that is sharp enough to eliminate ghosting, graininess, or optical grating, which allows you to experience visual details you can’t see with typical displays.
 3650 PPI See-Through Demo:
 Large Display Size & FOV 
GodView creates a massive 300’’ virtual display with a binocular 110-degree wide field of view (FOV) that naturally merges virtual details into the real-world viewed through the lens, for an incredibly immersive experience.
NB. I am an animated GIF - give me a second to load :-)
 High Refresh Rate & Brightness
  GodView supports a 90Hz refresh rate so the images you see are always extremely smooth without visible flickering, and with a brightness up to 2000 nits, the display is ultra-clear even in bright daylight.
Myopia Adaptability
If you wear glasses, it’s time to put them aside! GodView can self-tune its clarity for myopia of -8~0D, which means near-sighted users can see clearly and comfortably without wearing their everyday glasses or contacts. (Offered as an optional function in addition to the standard model). By continuously controlling the change of focal length, the eye can be trained to achieve the purpose of adjusting myopia. Holographic optics change and adjust the focal length automatically according to an advanced algorithm.
NB. I am an animated GIF - give me a second to load :-)
GodView opts for a sunglasses-like design without a heavy battery or processor on-board so they remain stylish and comfortable for extended use. Super lightweight and cable-free connectivity make them effortlessly wearable. Without the distraction of cords or a bulky headset, you can indulge yourself completely with ‘God’s view’ and enjoy the best visuals.

  Why Super Waveguide 
GodView utilizes the super waveguide optical solution made of lightweight resin. This innovation transforms the conventional head-mounted display into an everyday fashion item weighing just 55g, less than 1/10 of Microsoft HoloLens
 Wi-Fi Connectivity 
GodView achieves its unique lightweight performance without a heavy battery or processor onboard. It uses a compact Wi-Fi 6 bridge housing a power supply that can work continuously for over 4 hours and any multimedia on your smartphone can be cast wirelessly to the GodView virtual display in front of your eyes. It’s the ultimate high definition visual experience at home or on the go.
NB. I am an animated GIF - give me a second to load :-)
Much of our time is spent on electronic devices, it’s a way to stay connected as well as our main form of entertainment. Instead of simply being an entertainment gadget, GodView becomes part of the fun itself. It is a useful extension of all your existing electronic interfaces, seizing every idle moment for fun. Carpe diem!
NB. I am an animated GIF - give me a second to load :-)
NB. I am an animated GIF - give me a second to load :-)
Omni-Compatibility
GodView is multi-compatible with devices like laptops, desktops, and game consoles via the world’s first zero-lag GodView mini HDMI to Type-c Cable. Plug & Play has never been so easy! Enjoy a stunning new visual world in an instant.

- Boost your productivity on the go with the powerful GodView PickMini (5G Cellular Mini-PC). You can use a Windows-based operating system to run any office applications. GodView is your best mobile office companion on the go.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
GodView has years of development & manufacture of near eyes display and components, so we are very confident to fulfill the production & delivery as promised.

However, at each stage, there are some common problems that may occur before you receive the reward. GodView is well-prepared to overcome all obstacles and provide a carefree experience throughout the campaign.

To guarantee a safe and cost-effective delivery for you, we will apply the best shipping method available. The efficiency of shipping varies in different destination countries. Especially under the worldwide outbreak, it may take a bit more time than usual. Our product contains the battery, which makes it more difficult to ship. Our team will try our best to facilitate the process and provide the best service for you, who help us reach the funding goal.

There will be complete transparency of information for you. If something unexpected happens, we promise to keep you updated with the raw fact and our countermeasures. This is our first attempt on a Kickstarter, we hope and work for the best to make GodView a back-worthy project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

project_data.project_name: GodView | Lightest 5K AR/MR Smart Glasses For All Devices

campaign.story:
The keyboard allows you to control your device, but what if a keyboard could do much more than that? The Kolude Hub version is designed with an all-in-one docking function that lets you read and transfer data, and charge your keyboard or other devices, all at an extremely fast rate—doing what no other keyboard could do. 
If you’re a busy traveler who needs a spectacular keyboard to go with you wherever adventure, work or business takes you, we have a special Bluetooth version of the Kolude KD-K2 Keyboard. Along with being extremely compact and portable, the Bluetooth version offers you a truly wireless experience. The built-in 850 mAh lithium battery provides you 10 hours of continuous working time with a backlight and 650 hours without a backlight. In short, with the Bluetooth version, the Kolude KD-K2 allows you to get everything done and going wherever you are, wherever you go!

If you’re happy with your Mac or iPad, you’ll be thrilled to have an extremely advanced multifunctional keyboard hub that lets you do more—whether it’s work or play—with your Apple Devices. We’re introducing the Kolude KD-K2 Aluminum Keyboard, designed to let you extract even more value from your Apple devices, having far more gaming fun or working efficiency with a keyboard hub like no other. 
A superb feature of the keyboard that deserves a highlight is the Full Functional Host, a USB 3.1 type-C uplink interface that not only supports iPad 11”/”12.9 and MacBooks with USB-C generations, but also other non-Apple devices, such as Surface Pro7 and other laptops and tablets with a USB-C interface. 
The Kolude KD-K2 Aluminum Keyboard is equipped with Hotkey functions that are compatible with iPad OS and Mac OS. At the same time, we’ve added more optimization functionalities for Windows to achieve higher compatibility, and a switching play between Mac and Windows just by pressing several keys combined. 
The Kolude KD-K2 Keyboard is made from premium aluminum. That makes it an extremely stylish keyboard that’s also robust and made to last. At the same time, the aluminum structure prevents the device from overheating and from feeling too hot when you use it, and it keeps it extremely lightweight and easy to carry.

An impressive design that kills your productivity doesn’t impress us at all. That’s why we’ve built the Kolude KD-K2 Aluminum Keyboard with round groove buttons with scissor-switch keys. This ensures that you have highly reliable, responsive and quiet keys with short travel times that perform wonderfully when it comes to typing. After all, what’s a keyboard good for if not for typing, right?

Now this is a matter of personal preference, which is why we created three options. You can have your Kolude KD-K2 in silvery, gray, black version. Either way, this is the ultimate keyboard that you’ll definitely enjoy working or playing with!
This is not our first Kickstarter campaign. In fact, in March 2020, we completed a successful Kickstarter for the Kolude KD-K1, the previous version of the now launched keyboard. We raised a total of USD $172,000, over 1,000% of our funding goal, and we diligently fulfilled our rewards to our backers. That tells you that we have the experience, technical knowledge and background to create a new Kickstarter success story for the Kolude KD-K2 Keyboard, which can now be yours!
Kolude was founded in Shenzhen, China, where our own established factory with more than 100 professionals who work every day on every stage to get our products excellently manufactured. We also have a team of highly experienced designers who focus on designing and creating state-of-the-art electronic and non-electronic accessories, such as Kolude KD-K2, which we’re now presenting to you.

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Like all Kickstarter projects, we will face certain risks and challenges in delivering this product at the quality we demand of ourselves. However, the Kolude team brings with it not only our passion but experience in engineering and manufacturing at scale, and we've made every effort to mitigate these risks for our backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear backers

We've showed the problem to KS and hopefully it can be solved. As one backer mentioned in the comment section,  the survey appears only to work when filled out from a desktop computer. it might not support iPad or iPhone. Please have a try and come back to us if you have another problem.

Dear backers

Some of you said that the submit button did not work. In response, we have set the address to changeable. Please try it again. If it still doesn't work, we will collect the shipping information manually. Thank you for your patience.

campaign.story:
Press Release | Earn 10% cashback for every referral, by helping us spread the word
Please note that 
For Kickstarter, we are only offering the charger in a special Kickstarter edition BLACK color (see photos under Rewards section below). White color chargers are for illustrative purposes and may be offered later at retail after fulfillment for Kickstarter is completed.
We will only be shipping rewards to USA/Canada addresses for this project. We will not offer International (outside USA/Canada) shipping for this project due to unpredictable postal shipping times and costs as a result of COVID-19.
We do not recommend using plug adapters for this charger as plug adapters are generally not rated for 1500W pass-through power and will not support the stacking ability of this charger. As such, we will also not be offering any plug adapters for this charger. This further reinforces our decision not to offer International shipping.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused to our international backers. As an alternative solution, you can get our bestselling, most crowdfunded 100W GaN Charger with free International plug adapters for 30% off here (discount applied at checkout) which will more than enough pay for any courier express shipping that is less affected by COVID-19 restrictions. The promo expires on 10/25/2020.
++
9to5mac: Hands-on HyperJuice Stackable GaN 
 The Verge: "More Impressive Than Its Last"
 SlashGear: "The Holy Grail of Chargers" 
++
From the makers of the bestselling GaN Charger 
In 2019, HYPER created the world's first and smallest 100W GaN charger which went on to raise over $3.3M between Kickstarter and Indiegogo, making it the world's most crowdfunded and bestselling GaN charger product. Now from Hyper...
Comes an even smaller and better GaN charger
Smaller than a tiny box of mints
HyperJuice 65W
HyperJuice 100W
More than 20% smaller than the previous model with more power, features & USB-C ports 
Available in 2 sizes (65W and 100W)
HyperJuice 65W with 3 charging ports (2 x USB-C and 1 x USB-A)
HyperJuice 100W with 4 charging ports (3 x USB-C and 1 x USB-A)
65W charges 3 devices (2 x USB-C & 1 x USB-A)
Quick charge a laptop, tablet, and smartphone all at the same time.
100W charges 4 devices (3 x USB-C & 1 x USB-A)
Quick charge a laptop, tablet, smartphone, and USB device all at the same time. 
Bulky chargers can fall off the wall power outlet
HyperJuice with foldable pins stay close to the wall
So they will never fall off. 
With built-in outlet that supports up to 1500W
Rated at 1500W, it can power the most demanding electronics and appliances. HyperJuice uses a power outlet but also gives one back. Easily insert HyperJuice into any situation even when there are no available power outlets.
Fighting over a single power outlet?
Gone are the days of running out of available power outlets. HyperJuice does everything from a single outlet. 
HyperJuice stacks upon itself and let you power multiple laptops from a single power outlet
Power 4 laptops from a single power outlet and even more... 
Stack up to 16 chargers for 1600W of power
HyperJuice Stackable Chargers are rated to pass through 1500W of power so you can stack a total of 16 x 100W chargers to create a 1600W supercharger with 48 x USB-C and 16 x USB-A ports, all over a single power outlet. 
Smaller than every other 100W charger out there
Smaller than Anker Atom PD 4 (100W), Apple 96W, Apple 61W & HyperJuice 100W 2C2A (2019)
Powered by the latest Gallium Nitride (Navitas GaNFast) Technology 
HyperJuice utilizes the industry-leading Navitas GaNFast NV6125/NV6127 Power IC to miniaturize components normally found in traditional chargers. The new Gallium Nitride semiconductor material allows for power devices that can operate at higher voltages and switching frequency which results in smaller and more efficient chargers.
See the following video to learn more about GaN:
Sophisticated Design (Worldwide Patented)
HYPER is the pioneer of delivering 100W of power in a GaN charger and we have been working for almost a year perfecting the circuit design and firmware to fully utilize the Navitas GaNFast NV6125/NV6127 Power IC to bring the HyperJuice charger to fruition.
We want to make the smallest 65W and 100W charger ever so the circuit board and components are laid out in the most compact and space-efficient manner. Only the industry's most efficient components that can deliver the best performance in the smallest of space are used. The dense circuit board is then surrounded by high-density thin heat sinks to aid in heat dissipation. The entire package is then wrapped in a minimalist fire-resistant polycarbonate enclosure to complete the efficient design.
HyperJuice 65W Exploded View
HyperJuice 65W Exploded View
HyperJuice 100W Exploded View
HyperJuice 100W Exploded View
Proof of Concept Video
The following single shot unedited video of working prototypes of the HyperJuice 65W and 100W Stackable GaN Chargers demonstrate that even after stacking 3 chargers over a single power outlet, it is able to pass through more than 1600W of power to power a water kettle and each HyperJuice 65W/100W charger is still able to provide the maximum power of 65W and 100W respectively.
PLAY

Product Specifications
HyperJuice 65W and HyperJuice 100W

HyperJuice 65W
HyperJuice 65W smaller than a tiny box of mints
 Product Dimensions: 72 x 36 x 30.5mm / 2.83" x 1.42" x 1.2"

 Power Input: AC 100-240V 50/60Hz 2.4A

 USB-C2: 65W Power Delivery 3.0, PPS 3.3~21V3.23A, 5/9/12/15V3A, 20V3.25A
 USB-A1: SCP 3.4~5V, Quick Charge 3.0, 5V/3A, 9V/2A, 12V/1.5A
 Protocol: BC1.2, Apple 2.4A, AFC, FCP, SCP, QC2.0/3.0/4.0+, PD2.0/3.0, PPS

HyperJuice 100W
HyperJuice 100W smaller than a box of mints

 PCBA Structure: HQR GaN

 Protection: Over-current, Over-voltage, Over-temperature, Short-circuit Protection
Rewards
In order to simplify Kickstarter reward fulfillment so that we can get all the chargers out to everyone as soon as possible, we are only offering the charger in a special Kickstarter edition BLACK color (see photos below). We love Black and many backers have asked for Black for our previous project because Black color is more stain-resistant in the long run. White color chargers are for illustrative purposes and may be offered later at retail after fulfillment for Kickstarter is completed. Please understand that having multiple color choices, especially for different chargers within the same reward will just complicate and delay the entire Kickstarter fulfillment process. For example, we won't be able to ask for your color choices until after the project ends via a survey which means we cannot accurately prepare the rewards beforehand.

From the team that brought you the World's First 100W USB-C battery pack and Kickstarter Most Funded power bank project
(as well as the world's 1st, smallest, and most crowdfunded 100W GaN charger)
About Us
HYPER by Sanho Corporation has been making award-winning USB-C products since 2015. We also have a long proven track record of delivering Kickstarter and Indiegogo projects. Our most successful Kickstarter and Indiegogo project, HyperDrive USB-C Hub for MacBook Pro, raised over $3.1 million and is currently the most crowdfunded MacBook and USB-C accessory. Our latest Kickstarter and Indiegogo, HyperJuice 100W GaN Charger, which raised over $3.3 million is the most crowdfunded USB-C charger. The HyperJuice 130W USB-C Battery Pack is the most crowdfunded power bank project on Kickstarter ($1.4M). Our HyperDrive USB-C Hub for iPad Pro is the most crowdfunded iPad accessory ($1.2M) and many more. So we do have a lot of experience with USB-C and Apple products. This is our 26th crowdfunding project. Our previous crowdfunding projects have altogether raised over $14 million and we have delivered to over 140,000 backers.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
Big thanks to Team MVP for producing our awesome video and product photos.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No project is without risk and challenges but we try to do our absolute best to minimize them. We felt that we have done all the necessary preliminary work prior to coming to Kickstarter. We are also no strangers to portable power, USB-C, mobile accessories or crowdfunding.

The HyperJuice charger that you see in the above video/photos are actual full working prototypes.

With your support, we can bring HyperJuice to users everywhere. We have started mass production and your contribution will help us achieve economies of scale and keep the product cost low.

We have sufficient materials to manufacture about 5,000 units now. Beyond that, the lead time is about a month. Your strong support will give us the needed affirmation to place a larger raw materials order and start mass production earlier.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi HyperJuice Backers,
This is the update you have been waiting for.
To recap what happened last month, our third-party fulfillment warehouse encountered technical errors on their end, which caused us to delay the subsequent scheduled fulfillment to prevent shipping errors. We apologize for the delay. The good news is, this has been cleared up, and we're ready for the final stretch.

Hi HyperJuice Backers,
This update will be short but has good news. As of now, all Early Bird shipments that have completed the survey should be in transit. Look to your email, as tracking numbers have been updated for those who are shipping. As for everyone else, we will begin shipping today by backer number and continue to ship as we get more inventory. For everyone that has completed their shipping survey, we estimate being complete by the end of next month.

Hi HyperJuice backers,
We appreciate your patience throughout our campaign. Starting this Friday, our 100W units will begin transit to our US distribution center. We will be using the first batch to cover Early Birds, so shipping for them will start Early to Mid April. The next set of shipments after that are currently estimated to be either end of April or the beginning of May. We are pushing to get these in your hands as soon as possible and will update you as things progress.

Thank you for all your great feedback and support! We are looking forward to shipping the rewards next month.

Earlier this month, we experienced a production delay as the outer casing tooling caused a slight surface defect on the product enclosure. We needed to rectify the defect to ensure the quality of the production. We have resumed production and the production teams are doing their best to minimize the delay. Thank you for all your great feedback and support! We are looking forward to shipping the rewards next month.

campaign.story:
PowerCloud brings a power strip renaissance as the world’s first to achieve the highest PD 65W USB output in the smallest enclosure on the market. It establishes the standard for future USB power strips by providing higher speed charges for all your appliances including laptops while eliminating the need for adapters.
Functionality doesn’t have to come at a cost of good design. Adopting a tradition-defying look, sleek outline and fireproof glossy coating, PowerCloud transcends into a sophisticated desktop powerhouse to keep a complete workstation and entertainment center fully powered and charged.
It is a must-have essential for working from home. If you are busy working to a tight schedule at home in the presence of your family, Powercloud automatically keeps all the cords and devices organized so well and makes clutters and messes disappear for good.

PowerCloud is a power strip equipped with 3 AC outlets, 2 USB-C Power Delivery (PD) ports and 1 USB-A Quick Charge (QC) port.
In addition to providing a large amount of power for electrical devices such as computers, TVs, printers and lighting, it also offers blazing-fast, adapter-free, cable-only USB charges to phones, tablets, and laptops.

Leading the way is the 65W of USB-C power - the highest of all on the market - able to give your 13” MackBook Pro or MacBook Air a full-speed charge without the need for additional usb power bricks.
If you commute daily between your residence and workplace, you can have one PowerCloud at home and one in the office, then you can say goodbye to those heavy, bulky adapters without worrying about your devices running out of power.
If you travel a lot, you just need to bring one PowerCloud which fits perfectly in your backpack instead of lugging around several big power adapters to have all of your devices powered up or charged up at maximum speed.
PowerCloud not only supports PD3.0 fast charge tech through its dual USB-C ports but also QC3.0 through the USB-A port rated at 18W, able to charge compatible devices up to 4 times faster than a conventional USB power strip. For instance, you can charge your smartphone up to 80% in just 30 minutes.
PowerCloud can quickly charge everything you throw at it. In addition to smartphones, tablets and laptops, it also works with Nintendo switch, Kindle, power banks, keyboard, headphones, smart watches, table fan and light.

PowerCloud packs three AC outlets in its compact footprint which are widely spaced to accommodate even oversized plugs and power adapters without overlapping.
The contact points inside the socket are made with absolute precision at a level of 0.1mm and subjected to rigorous tests to ensure secure grips after thousands of times of use. It won’t become loose or wear out over time to cause heat or sparks, nor too tight to budge the prongs.
PowerCloud puts the safety of you and your expensive electronics above all else by employing an all-around 10-fold protection. It offers safeguards against overheat, overcurrent, overvoltage, overcharge, short circuit, overload, undervoltage and electrical shock, fried components, pokes of fingers or other objects. It also comes with a fire-resistant casing of the highest fireproof standard in the industry.
Don't work with an office or live with a home tied down by messy wires and tangles of electric cords. Powercloud helps keep your space clutter-free and your mind stress-free for maximum productivity and creativity. The ports on the PowerCloud are strategically arranged in two separate zones: the top zone dedicated to AC outlets and the front zone dedicated to DC usb outputs. The power cables on the front can be routed to the back and hidden from sight. The USB cables on the front are easy to access and quick to plug/unplug. So they won’t end up unruly and bundled up together. And the separation of high- and low-voltage ports eliminates the risk of electric shock and fire hazards.
PowerCloud is the best 6-port charging station for multiple devices. It connects up to 6 devices simultaneously, meeting the diverse power needs for work and play of the whole family.


Combined with smart IC, PowerCloud automatically detects and adjusts the power for connected devices accordingly and ensures rapid, optimal charging while greatly extending the lifespan of the batteries.

PowerCloud packs 65W of USB power, which can either be distributed throughout the three ports or dedicated solely to the USB-C port with a minimum of 45W output even when all the ports are plugged in, giving your laptop or tablet a good amount of juice.
PowerCloud sports a minimalist design which will blend in nicely sitting next to your iMac, MacBook or iPhone. It is a departure from blocky, tedious power strips that are meant to hide under desks and behind furniture. You can leave it in plain sight on a desk or table top as a decor which adds functional style to a workspace at home or in the office.

There is a LED light which will illuminate green when your devices are being charged, and a master switch to turn on and off all power.
Since 2008, Torras has been a brand that never settles for mediocrity and is full of aspirations and dreams. It is committed to providing users with high-quality consumer electronic products.
Torras has always adhered to the five principles of "Lifestyle", "Useful", "Basic", "Simple" and "Natural", advocating the design concept of "Simple but Unique".
As of April 2020, Torras has registered as many as 224 trademarks in 41 countries around the globe. The head office has applied for nearly 1,600 product patents, and has obtained 1,100 authorizations. Torras has a cumulative sales of more than 1 billion products, receiving positive comments and reputation from consumers worldwide. Torras believes in utilizing products to connect with people, to boost their senses of happiness and to add values to the world. Let us all unite and participate in the cause of ecological environmental protection in response to the rising trend of “Go green and eco-friendly”. In a more challenging and competitive market, Torras wants to create an exquisite and technological power strip which is going to be an industrial milestone.

 Learn2Play put together a Play-Through Video for everyone to check out. 
 Each Game will starts with Drawing 1 OMEN Card per player. On each Omen card it outlines how many Room Tiles, How Many Enemies Start, and Boss health cards at the start of the game. 
Players will use these tiles to construct the map. There are 4 types of tiles: Enemy Spawn Tiles, Player Spawn Tiles, Regular Tiles, and The VAULT. Players will start by placing The Vault tile, then regular Tiles ending with spawn tiles.  
Once all the regular tiles are placed, Players can now choose where to place their spawn tiles and the enemy spawn tiles. 
Each character also has a unique set of actions, such as how far they can move and how many tokens they can use.
Players will have to use their abilities and their tokens to scare enemies away from the Scare Factory. Eventually, you will have to fight off the boss that is leading the attack. Work together and combine your abilities in order to stop the humans from commercializing fear itself! If you want to know more or see the game in action, take a look at the videos on our page. Start defending The Scare Factory from those pesky humans and capitalists! 
Speaking of which, the enemies in Scare Factory get a turn all to themselves. They each spawn on a unique enemy tile at the start of the game. They roll a dice which dictates where they go. Sometimes, if you’re lucky, you can choose where they go. Most of the time they will search the factory for you, so you have to be careful!
When an enemy is fooled into stepping on a scare token, they will be scared. Players then roll to see which direction they go. Again, like regular enemy movement, there is a chance that players can control where the enemies go. Sometimes the enemy will flee the board immediately. We will discuss that in a moment. If you land on another scare token, this starts a scare chain! After three scares, an enemy flees, removing them from the board. One of the most important parts of the game is these scare chains. 
Another big aspect of enemy interaction is Ward Tokens. If an enemy walks into a ward token, players become able to move said enemy wherever they choose. As you may be able to tell, this is very helpful in completing a scare chain.
The Boss is a very powerful force to be reckoned with, so it’s best to be on your toes. The boss will not be active at the start, letting minions do the dirty work, but inevitably they will come to deal with meddling interlopers (like you) themselves! Bosses have a set of ability cards that give them and the other enemies new powers. There are 32 total, but only 5 are active at a time.  
These abilities serve another important purpose: they act as the bosses' life. With each scare you pull off while the boss is active, you can remove an ability from the pile. Once this is done, the ability underneath is revealed and becomes active during the boss phase. Keep fighting through and remove all the cards in order to win! Hopefully, this has given you a bit more insight into the threat you are fighting against! Good luck in your fight to free the Scare Factory!
Do you want to Test Play 'The Scare Factory' ? If so sign-up to get access to a tabletop simulator version. SIGN UP
The game is 100% playable without stretch goals, but we feel these are great incentives to provide to our backers for helping us fund 'The Scare Factory'. Also all stretch goals will be considered KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!!!!!   
MORE TO COME!!!!
 Being a first-time creator on Kickstarter we knew miniature production is a huge aspect of having an immersive player experience. I wanted to share a bit of our story about how we developed our miniatures.
Initially, we wanted amazing characters in the game, but we also wanted them to look great. Our first step was to concept everything in 2d. From the concepts, we went into 3d development with our Talented art team.  The 3d development was combined with many iterations from the Design team on how the characters should look and feel. Lastly, we purchased 2 3d resin printers to test each 3d model. After each character was 3d printed we made adjustments to height, the scale of objects, details, etc. Just so everyone is aware we did 3d print every single character a minimum of 3-5 times to make sure iterations improved. The Video below showcases the full process of the Man-O-War expansion Boss!!!

 As explained earlier we adjusted our character heights via iterations and came up with our own scale that we thought was a great fit. Our heights range between 33mm (humans) and 60mm (Players and Bosses) 
We really wanted to show off our amazing miniatures and decided to partner with a couple of painters. We reached out to Circle of Nerds and he offered an amazing paint demo (showcased below). We will also be doing a live painting demo with Life of a Board Gamer on October 20,2020 for everyone to check out. 
 Some More Showcases 
 Social Media
We have been doing quite a few posts on Instagram to show real pictures of the game and also have some youtube videos showing testing, art dev, and much more. Here are some links to check out our social media
Instagram
YouTube
BGG 
Shipping Details: All shipping prices are estimated in USD and are subject to change. We will also be partnering with Quartermaster Logistics to help with customs and tax friendly shipping. We will also be doing free local pickup for anyone located in The Greater Toronto or Kitchener/Waterloo Area. 
SupAR Games originally created in 2018. We focused our development on Augmented Reality technologies while doing some work for hire projects. We took our years of video game development and poured our efforts into 'The Scare Factory'. We brought on an art team, design team, and multiple testers. Together we have spent over 5000 hours to bring you 'The Scare Factory'
 Special Thanks to the people below to help us showcase 'The Scare Factory'
Lance Hinkel from Learn 2 Play for Learn to Play Video and Overview 
Mark Streed from Dice Tower for the Preview 
OMG Nexus for Interview and an Overview 
Louie Martinez from Circle of Nerds for his Miniature painting demo
Danijel Ljubas from Life of a Board Gamer for his painting livestream on October 20
Stephanie Cassandra from Minimum Player Count for a great video (coming soon)
Both Sides of My Table for an awesome written preview
and the friends and family that help support the development of The Scare Factory
 Our timeline has been carefully planned. With the majority of art already created we will only need some touchups for production and template focused. We have already reached out to multiple manufacturers and they are prepared to take on our project. There is always a chance of delay, but we will make sure to let the backers know about any delays in production. 
 Pledge Manager will be Backerkit
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Scare Factory is the first tabletop game that SupAR Games has worked on. Thanks to our experienced staff we have done our best to avoid the classic pitfalls that many first time projects fall into, but we still feel that it’s important for you to know. We have assembled a team with a wide variety of skills to ensure that we are able to not only create the best content we can, but also to get different voices to help keep our goals realistic and our vision achievable. The main game art has mostly been completed already. The only new art that would be needed is for stretch goals and updating for printing components. That will allow us to get into production quite fast. 

We are working hard to ensure that production will go smoothly, but as you may expect, it is possible that there may be COVID-19 related delays. We will keep you updated if there are any delays and/or changes in the future.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
So with the end near in sight. We've had a ton of responses on our survey for what to do next time. Feel free to fill it out over the next day or two. We will also be posting the survey post the campaign for people to sign up for our email list for relaunch. 

Lastly, I want to give a shout out to Redi Games for Penny Dreadfun. Looks like an awesome game you can check it out at 
http://kck.st/34R3wW2

For us to get the most amount of feedback on our Cancellation Survey we will be running this campaign out. 

From the feedback given seems like alot of people would want access to a lower cost version of the game. Therefore, we are thinking of doing a base version in the relaunch where we go mostly tokens for enemies and make bosses and players maybe as the main miniatures.

updates.update_userinfo: Planning our Cancellation :( BUT WE WILL BE BACK !!!!
updates.update_content:
With Sad Regret. It doesn't look like we will be hitting our funding Goal for 'The Scare Factory'. We are looking at a possible relaunch and have created a short survey for people that may be interested in the relaunch. If you are interested please fill out the Survey. The information will be kept confidential and will help us plan our Relaunch in the future
Thanks again to all who supported us. We will leave the campaign open for people to review and ask questions, comments, etc.

An awesome project on Kickstarter called Early Haunts. http://kck.st/35sNdjd
We’re talking about possible graphic novel ideas together for The Scare Factory. Check them out.

updates.update_userinfo: Sadly not getting the traction we need
updates.update_content: We are sadly not getting the traction we were hoping for to make The Scare Factory. We have a final marketing push going live this weekend. If that doesn't help push the project to a reasonable funding level we are afraid that we will be considering a cancellation and a possible re-launch some time in the near future. However, we would love to hear from the community on what might've been holding you back about the project and would also love those interested in signing up for the relaunch to be notified. Early next week we will setup a small survey to ask these questions, or feel free to leave comments. We do have over 800 people who have set a reminder for this project, so we know there is a ton of interest. Help us improve for when we relaunch in the future.

Professionally printed deck of poker size playing cards in a custom printed tuck box. The cards will be printed in four suit colors, orange for diamonds, green for clubs, red for hearts, and blue for spades. Pictured on the cards are 14 characters from the Midway of the 1893 Chicago World's Fair. On the back of each card in blue is the first ever Ferris Wheel from that Fair.
Add $10 to your pledge for each additional deck of cards you want to receive. I will take care of the additional shipping cost up to five decks.

Add $12 to your pledge for each additional book you want to receive. I will take care of the additional shipping cost.

campaign.story:
Creating GUI Applications with wxPython is a book that will teach you how to use wxPython to create applications by actually creating several mini-programs. I have found that while learning how the various widgets work in wxPython is valuable, it is even better to learn by creating a simple application that does something useful.
The code in this book will be targeted for Python 3 only using wxPython 4.
Note: If you missed the campaign, you can still get the book over on Leanpub. It will also be available on Amazon, Gumroad and other retailers in May 2018.
Creating GUI Applications with wxPython
The code in this book will run on all 3 major platforms:
Windows 
Mac 
Linux
In this book, we will be creating the following applications:
A simple image viewer 
A database viewer 
A database editor 
Calculator
An archiving application (zip / tar) 
PDF merging application 
XML Editor 
We will also learn how to turn your applications into executables for Windows.
As you learn how to create these applications, you will also learn how wxPython works. We will go over how wxPython's event system works, how to use threads in wxPython, make use of sizers and much, much more!
Stretch Goal #1: $5500 (COMPLETE)
Add chapters on the following topics:
MP3 Tag Editor
NASA image downloader / search tool
Stretch Goal #2: $8000
Add new chapters that cover
File search utility ($6500)
Simple FTP application ($7250) 
Graph creator (or TBA) ($8000)
Release Date
I expect to have this book finished by May 2019
Writing Style 
This book will be written using my original conversational style. What this means is that the chapters will probably vary in size more than most programming books. 
I still follow the rule of giving simple examples paired with simple explanations instead of spending an inordinate amount of time re-explaining the same subject over and over.
If you've never read anything of mine before, you can download Python 101 for free or read it online. You can also check out my blog for writing examples.
Who should read this book? 
This book is for someone who already uses Python and would like to learn how to use Python to create fun cross-platform graphical user interfaces.
What's the money for?
ISBNs cost money, especially if you have multiple formats of the book (paperback, PDF, mobi, etc). The money will also cover the initial print run of the book for the backers. It will also cover copyright registration and the cost of my illustrator. It would be great if I could do some web advertising as well. 
I'm looking forward to working with my backers to make the best Python book possible!
About the Author
I'm a professional full time Python programmer by day and Python blogger by night. I've been programming almost exclusively in Python for almost 10 years. I co-authored Core Python for DZone. I also ran a successful campaign for my other books:
Python 101 
Python 201: Intermediate Python
ReportLab: PDF Processing with Python
Jupyter Notebook 101
I have two books that are also published by publishers other than myself:
wxPython Recipes (Apress)
Python Interviews (Packt)
Book formats 
The finished book will be made available in the following formats:
paperback (at the appropriate perk level) 
PDF 
mobi (Kindle format)
epub
